metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19377 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21, mounting a crafted btrfs filesystem image, performing some operations, and unmounting can lead to a use-after-free in btrfs_queue_work in fs/btrfs/async-thread.c. It was discovered that the btrfs implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly detect that a block was marked dirty in some situations. An attacker could use this to specially craft a file system image that, when unmounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19377` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-5.19.0-46-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-46-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1028-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1029-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1027-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1026-kvm - 5.15.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1026-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1022-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-5.19.0-1022-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1021-generic - 5.15.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-23-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-5.19.0-23-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1011-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1010-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Exploiting this vulnerability requires a crafted filesystem image to be mounted
